CVE-2024-6768
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T19:15:17.120000

4 posts

A Denial of Service in CLFS.sys in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated low-privilege user to cause a Blue Screen of Death via a forced call to the KeBugCheckEx function.

mttaggart@infosec.town at 2024-08-12T18:29:16.791Z ##

Hmmm. Fortra is claiming this CVE, but Microsoft refuses to acknowledge it.

A Denial of Service in CLFS.sys in Microsoft Windows 10, Windows 11, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2019, and Windows Server 2022 allows a malicious authenticated low-privilege user to cause a Blue Screen of Death via a forced call to the KeBugCheckEx function.
www.fortra.com/security/advisories/research/fr-2024-001

#CVE_2024_6768

##

CVE-2024-7264
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-12T18:31:48

4 posts

libcurl's ASN1 parser code has the `GTime2str()` function, used for parsing an ASN.1 Generalized Time field. If given an syntactically incorrect field, the parser might end up using -1 for the length of the *time fraction*, leading to a `strlen()` getting performed on a pointer to a heap buffer area that is not (purposely) null terminated. This flaw most likely leads to a crash, but can also lead

1 repos

#search_error

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-08-01T22:06:13.000Z ##

The original #hackerone report for #curl's CVE-2024-7264: ASN.1 date parser overread is now published:

https://hackerone.com/reports/2629968

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-07-31T07:05:35.000Z ##

Read about CVE-2024-7264: ASN.1 date parser overread here:

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-7264.html

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-08-01T22:06:13.000Z ##

The original #hackerone report for #curl's CVE-2024-7264: ASN.1 date parser overread is now published:

https://hackerone.com/reports/2629968

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-07-31T07:05:35.000Z ##

Read about CVE-2024-7264: ASN.1 date parser overread here:

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-7264.html

##

CVE-2024-7532
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T18:31:14.987000

4 posts

Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE in Google Chrome prior to 127.0.6533.99 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Critical)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.493Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.493Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-36877(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T18:30:51

1 posts

Micro-Star International Z-series motherboards (Z590, Z490, and Z790) and B-series motherboards (B760, B560, B660, and B460) with firmware 7D25v14, 7D25v17 to 7D25v19, and 7D25v1A to 7D25v1H was discovered to contain a write-what-where condition in the in the SW handler for SMI 0xE3.

CVE-2024-42219
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T18:30:21.627000

20 posts

1Password 8 before 8.10.36 for macOS allows local attackers to exfiltrate vault items because XPC inter-process communication validation is insufficient.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-08T12:45:03.000Z ##

Critical 1Password Vulnerability: Hackers Could Exploit Security Flaw to Access Unlock Keys https://thecyberexpress.com/critical-1password-vulnerability/ #CVE202442219vulnerability #1Passwordpasswordmanager #1Passwordvulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202442219

##
b2d670de53b27691c0c3400225b65c35a26d06093bcc41f48ffc71e0907f9d4a@mostr.pub at 2024-08-08T17:49:51.000Z ## If you run #1Password on a #macOS machine, update asap #CVE202442219

https://support.1password.com/kb/202408a/ ##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-08T12:45:03.000Z ##

Critical 1Password Vulnerability: Hackers Could Exploit Security Flaw to Access Unlock Keys https://thecyberexpress.com/critical-1password-vulnerability/ #CVE202442219vulnerability #1Passwordpasswordmanager #1Passwordvulnerability #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202442219

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-08T01:48:18.579Z ##

1Password security advisory: CVE-2024-42219 for 1Password 8 for Mac
CVE-2024-42219 (CISA-ADP CVSSv3: 7.0 high) 1Password 8 before 8.10.36 for macOS allows local attackers to exfiltrate vault items because XPC inter-process communication validation is insufficient.

To exploit the issue, an attacker must run malicious software on a computer specifically targeting 1Password for Mac. An attacker is able to misuse missing macOS specific inter-process validations to hijack or impersonate a trusted 1Password integration such as the 1Password browser extension or CLI.
This would permit the malicious software to exfiltrate vault items, as well as obtain derived values used to sign in to 1Password, specifically the account unlock key and âSRP-ð¥â

1Password has received no reports that this issue was discovered or exploited by anyone else.

#CVE_2024_42219 #1password #vulnerability #CVE

##
ycombinator@rss-mstdn.studiofreesia.com at 2024-08-07T22:51:10.000Z ##

https://www.forbes.com/sites/daveywinder/2024/08/07/critical-1password-security-flaw-could-let-hackers-steal-unlock-key/
#ycombinator #1Password #password_manager #1Password_security #Hacking_1Password #CVE_2024_42219 #red_team_hackers #password_hacking #1Password_for_macOS #macOS_password #macOS

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-09T12:35:04.000Z ##

Critical 1Password flaws may allow hackers to snatch your passwords (CVE-2024-42219, CVE-2024-42218) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/09/cve-2024-42219-cve-2024-42218/ #securityassessment #passwordmanager #vulnerability #Don'tmiss #1Password #passwords #Hotstuff #macOS #News #CVE

##
avoidthehack at 2024-08-08T19:43:03.970Z ##

CVE-2024-42219 for #1Password 8 for Mac

"To exploit the issue, an attacker must run malicious software on a computer specifically targeting 1Password for Mac. An attacker is able to misuse missing macOS specific inter-process validations to hijack or impersonate a trusted 1Password integration such as the 1Password browser extension or CLI."

No evidence of exploitation in the wild.

Naturally, you'd also have other issues alongside this (such as potentially dealing with other malware being dropped on the device, like RATs or infostealers).

I usually stick to and prefer Bitwarden... but for anyone using 1Password out there (once upon a time, I did) on macOS, make sure to update to 1Password for macOS version 8.10.36

#apple #security #macos #cybersecurity

https://support.1password.com/kb/202408a/

##
kurtseifried at 2024-08-08T17:12:22.021Z ##

You know what's missing from #1Password https://releases.1password.com/mac/8.10/ ? CVE-2024-42219 and the app/UI didn't prompt me significantly to update or mention a security issue. sad panda face. Do better 1Password.

CVE-2024-42473
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T18:03:58

1 posts

## Overview OpenFGA v1.5.7 and v1.5.8 are vulnerable to authorization bypass when calling Check API with a model that uses `but not` and `from` expressions and a userset. ## Fix - If you are using OpenFGA within Docker or as a Go library, as a binary, or through Docker, downgrade to v1.5.6 as soon as possible. - If using Helm chart, upgrade to 0.2.11 as soon as possible. This fix is backwar

openfga@mastodon.social at 2024-08-09T21:48:12.000Z ##

We introduced a regression in OpenFGA `v1.5.7`/`v.1.5.8` that causes OpenFGA to return incorrect values when calling the Check API for some specific models/tuples.
We are working on a fix, but meanwhile we recommend you to downgrade to `v1.5.6` until `v1.5.9` is released.

This has been assigned CVE-2024-42473

Details here https://github.com/openfga/openfga/security/advisories/GHSA-3f6g-m4hr-59h8

#OpenFGA #Security #CVE

##

CVE-2024-7589
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T16:35:05.763000

4 posts

A signal handler in sshd(8) may call a logging function that is not async-signal-safe. The signal handler is invoked when a client does not authenticate within the LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default). This signal handler executes in the context of the sshd(8)'s privileged code, which is not sandboxed and runs with full root privileges. This issue is another instance of the problem in CVE-20

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-12T12:05:02.000Z ##

CVE-2024-38200
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T15:30:50

16 posts

Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-12T14:58:10.597Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) CVE Update: CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
On 10 August 2024, Microsoft updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-38200, noting that it was publicly disclosed. While they mention that they "identified an alternative fix to this issue that we enabled via Feature Flighting on 7/30/2024. Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

cc: @TheDustinChilds to answer your question from the bad place: https://twitter.com/dustin_childs/status/1821664478435668053

#CVE_2024_38200 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.620Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

#Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38200 #CVE_2024_38218 #CVE_2024_38219 #Chromium #Chrome

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-12T14:58:10.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) CVE Update: CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
On 10 August 2024, Microsoft updated the security advisory for CVE-2024-38200, noting that it was publicly disclosed. While they mention that they "identified an alternative fix to this issue that we enabled via Feature Flighting on 7/30/2024. Customers are already protected on all in-support versions of Microsoft Office and Microsoft 365", the security updates section does not include a KB article or Download/build number. The fix is almost certainly coming out tomorrow on #PatchTuesday.

cc: @TheDustinChilds to answer your question from the bad place: https://twitter.com/dustin_childs/status/1821664478435668053

#CVE_2024_38200 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #CVE

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-12T11:00:08.000Z ##

Unpatched MS Office flaw may leak NTLM hashes to attackers (CVE-2024-38200) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/12/cve-2024-38200/ #authentication #Microsoft365 #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #MSOffice #PrivSec #0-day #News

##
alternativeto@mas.to at 2024-08-12T09:50:34.000Z ##

Microsoft reported a critical Office vulnerability (CVE-2024-38200) that could let attackers access NTLM hashes and login credentials. It affects Office 2016, 2019, LTSC 2021, and Microsoft 365. Users should update immediately and block NTLM traffic.
https://alternativeto.net/news/2024/8/microsoft-urges-updates-for-office-vulnerability-allowing-ntlm-hash-and-login-data-theft/

##
alternativeto@mas.to at 2024-08-12T09:50:34.000Z ##

Microsoft reported a critical Office vulnerability (CVE-2024-38200) that could let attackers access NTLM hashes and login credentials. It affects Office 2016, 2019, LTSC 2021, and Microsoft 365. Users should update immediately and block NTLM traffic.
https://alternativeto.net/news/2024/8/microsoft-urges-updates-for-office-vulnerability-allowing-ntlm-hash-and-login-data-theft/

##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-10T14:52:16.000Z ##

If you missed this yesterday:

CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-38218
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T15:30:50

4 posts

Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-08-08T22:14:41.620Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) has 9 total security advisories, 6 of which are just documenting that Edge is patched against Chromium vulnerabilities disclosed Tuesday by Google (see parent toot above). The new ones are as follows:

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

#Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE_2024_38200 #CVE_2024_38218 #CVE_2024_38219 #Chromium #Chrome

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-12T15:30:50

2 posts

An issue was discovered whereby Elastic Agent will leak secrets from the agent policy elastic-agent.yml only when the log level is configured to debug. By default the log level is set to info, where no leak occurs.

CVE-2024-37283 (CVSSv4: 6.5 medium) Elastic Agent Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File (ESA-2024-23)

  • CVE-2024-38200 (7.5 high) Microsoft Office Spoofing Vulnerability (Note: unpatched)
    • When will an update be available to address this vulnerability?
      Microsoft is fully aware of this issue and is actively working to release an update to address it.
  • CVE-2024-38218 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (HTML-based) Memory Corruption Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38219 (8.4 high) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely. Definitely read up on CVE-2024-38200 as no patch is available yet.

updated 2024-08-12T13:41:36.517000

Improper validation in a model specific register (MSR) could allow a malicious program with ring0 access to modify SMM configuration while SMI lock is enabled, potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-08-11T12:43:54.000Z ##

Patched my desktop PC for the Sinkclose (CVE-2023-31315) AMD cpu hardware vulnerability.

Of course, as always, the MSI firmware upgrade, nuked my Linux boot loader out of the EFI and I had to use a USB live-media to manually fix that using a grub-install ...

...

The vulnerability was discovered in April 2024 and has been addressed with the release of versions 23.0.14 and 27.1.0 in July 23, 2024."

CVE-2024-7535
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-08T21:32:01

2 posts

Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 127.0.6533.99 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.493Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

jbhall56 at 2024-07-31T11:09:25.703Z ##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-30T14:49:08.460Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2024-37085 (6.8 medium, disclosed 25 June 2024 by Broadcom) VMware ESXi authentication bypass vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog based on Microsoft's article from yesterday (see parent toot above).

cc: @iagox86 @hrbrmstr

#cybersecurity #infosec #advisory #ransomware
https://beyondmachines.net/event_details/microsoft-warns-ransomware-groups-exploiting-vmware-esxi-flaw-cve-2024-37085-o-w-g-h-8/gD2P6Ple2L

##

CVE-2024-21302
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-08T03:30:55

13 posts

Summary: Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce pre

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T18:58:27.645Z ##

MICROSOFT ZERO-DAYS (both CVE IDs are UNPATCHED)
As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.
Microsoft is developing a security update to mitigate this threat, but it is not yet available.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @wdormann @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T15:33:50.763Z ##

Security Week: Windows Update Flaws Allow Undetectable Downgrade Attacks
SafeBreach Labs is presenting at Black Hat 2024, warning that malicious hackers can launch software downgrade attacks (against Windows Update for example) that cause the operating system revert an immune, fully up-to-date software back to an older version with known, exploitable vulnerabilities, and to falsely report that it is fully updated.

Another key point from this article is that "Microsoft plans to publish a CVE on Wednesday alongside Leviev's Black Hat presentation and will provide customers with mitigations or relevant risk reduction guidance as they become available." EDIT: CVE-2024-21302 and CVE-2024-38202 were published. Unpatched and publicly disclosed!

EDIT2: See related SafeBreach article: Windows Downdate: Downgrade Attacks Using Windows Updates h/t @wdormann for finding it:

#downgradeattack #windowsupdate #CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T18:58:27.000Z ##

MICROSOFT ZERO-DAYS (both CVE IDs are UNPATCHED)
As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.
Microsoft is developing a security update to mitigate this threat, but it is not yet available.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @wdormann @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

Another key point from this article is that "Microsoft plans to publish a CVE on Wednesday alongside Leviev's Black Hat presentation and will provide customers with mitigations or relevant risk reduction guidance as they become available." As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.

##
avoidthehack at 2024-08-08T14:44:02.327Z ##

#Windows Update downgrade attack "unpatches" fully-updated systems

Downgrade attacks could rollback Windows updates, while Windows Update indicates the system is fully updated. Rollbacks could then expose the system to many past vulnerabilities.

(CVE-2024-38202 and CVE-2024-21302)

No apparent evidence of exploitation in the wild. #Microsoft is working/testing patches for this currently.

#cve #security #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/windows-update-downgrade-attack-unpatches-fully-updated-systems/

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-08T09:48:49.254Z ##

Zero-Day flaw that downgrades your Windows Systems -- CVE-2024-38202 , CVE-2024-21302

Advisory:

CVE-2024-38202 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38202

CVE-2024-21302 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-21302

Explaination by SafeBreach(who discovered this flaw):

https://www.safebreach.com/blog/downgrade-attacks-using-windows-updates/

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-08T14:44:02.000Z ##

#Windows Update downgrade attack "unpatches" fully-updated systems

Downgrade attacks could rollback Windows updates, while Windows Update indicates the system is fully updated. Rollbacks could then expose the system to many past vulnerabilities.

(CVE-2024-38202 and CVE-2024-21302)

No apparent evidence of exploitation in the wild. #Microsoft is working/testing patches for this currently.

#cve #security #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-38202
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-08T03:30:55

13 posts

Summary Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows Backup, potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of Virtualization Based Security (VBS). However, an attacker attempting to exploit this vulnerability requires additional interaction by a privileged user to

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T18:58:27.645Z ##

MICROSOFT ZERO-DAYS (both CVE IDs are UNPATCHED)
As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.
Microsoft is developing a security update to mitigate this threat, but it is not yet available.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @wdormann @ntkramer

#CVE_2024_21302 #CVE_2024_38202 #Microsoft #vulnerability #CVE

Another key point from this article is that "Microsoft plans to publish a CVE on Wednesday alongside Leviev's Black Hat presentation and will provide customers with mitigations or relevant risk reduction guidance as they become available." As promised, Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published not one but TWO security advisories in regards to a Windows Update issue allowing for software-downgrade attacks (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38202 (7.3 high) Windows Update Stack Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

Microsoft was notified that an elevation of privilege vulnerability exists in Windows based systems supporting Virtualization Based Security (VBS) including a subset of Azure Virtual Machine SKUS; enabling an attacker with administrator privileges to replace current versions of Windows system files with outdated versions. By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.
A security researcher informed Microsoft of an elevation of privilege vulnerability in Windows Backup potentially enabling an attacker with basic user privileges to reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities or circumvent some features of VBS. For exploitation to succeed, an attacker must trick or convince an Administrator or a user with delegated permissions into performing a system restore which inadvertently triggers the vulnerability.

  • CVE-2024-21302 (6.7 medium) Windows Secure Kernel Mode Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)

By exploiting this vulnerability, an attacker could reintroduce previously mitigated vulnerabilities, circumvent some features of VBS, and exfiltrate data protected by VBS.

##

CVE-2024-7550
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-07T21:31:45

2 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 127.0.6533.99 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.493Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-37286
(5.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T19:40:45

2 posts

APM server logs contain document body from a partially failed bulk index request. For example, in case of unavailable_shards_exception for a specific document, since the ES response line contains the document body, and that APM server logs the ES response line on error, the document is effectively logged.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-02T21:26:15.656Z ##

CVE-2024-37286 (5.7 medium) APM Server Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File. No mention of exploitation.

server.c in Neat VNC (aka neatvnc) before 0.8.1 does not properly validate the security type.

1 repos

#search_error

marreg@digitalcourage.social at 2024-08-03T20:00:40.000Z ##

via Salvatore

On Fri, Aug 02, 2024 at 02:46:48PM +0000, Dane Bouchie wrote:
> This issue is basically CVE-2006-2369
>
> On Aug 2, 2024 10:41 AM, Dane Bouchie <dbouchie@iradimed.com> wrote:
> The client chooses the security type, so they can pass in "None" to the switch statement. is_allowed_security_type() now prevents that.

FTR, this issue has the following CVE assigned:

https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-42458

CVE-2024-43044
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-07T18:16:38

3 posts

Jenkins uses the Remoting library (typically `agent.jar` or `remoting.jar`) for the communication between controller and agents. This library allows agents to load classes and classloader resources from the controller, so that Java objects sent from the controller (build steps, etc.) can be executed on agents. In addition to individual class and resource files, Remoting also allows Jenkins plugin

2 repos

https://github.com/HwMex0/CVE-2024-43044

https://github.com/jenkinsci-cert/SECURITY-3430

patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-08T04:33:56.366Z ##

CRITICAL : Path Transversal vulnerability in Jenkins.

CVE-2024-43044 : CVSS Score : 9.1

https://www.jenkins.io/security/advisory/2024-08-07/#SECURITY-3430

https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h856-ffvv-xvr4

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T15:20:11.230Z ##

Jenkins: Jenkins Security Advisory 2024-08-07

  • CVE-2024-43044 (vendor 9.0 critical) Arbitrary file read vulnerability through agent connections can lead to RCE
  • CVE-2024-43045 (vendor 5.4 medium) Missing permission check allows accessing other users' "My Views"

No mention of exploitation. Here's why you should care about CVE-2024-43044 and CVE-2024-4345: Jenkins, an open source automation server, has four vulnerabilities in CISA's Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog since 2022.

#CVE_2024_43044 #CVE_2024_43045 #Jenkins #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-22278
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-07T15:17:45

2 posts

### Impact Harbor fails to validate the maintainer role permissions when creating/updating/deleting project configurations - API call: - PUT /projects/{project_name_or_id}/metadatas/{meta_name} - POST /projects/{project_name_or_id}/metadatas/{meta_name} - DELETE /projects/{project_name_or_id}/metadatas/{meta_name} By sending a request to create/update/delete a metadata with an name that belongs

screaminggoat at 2024-08-01T13:12:09.426Z ##

Unit 42: Identifying a BOLA Vulnerability in Harbor, a Cloud-Native Container Registry
Unit 42 describes a vulnerability that they reported in Harbor, a cloud-native repository for storing and managing container images. Successful exploitation of CVE-2024-22278 (6.4 medium), a broken object-level authorization (BOLA), could allow an attacker in a Maintainer role to make a project public, deploy unverified images and bypass mandatory vulnerability scanning protocols. Unit 42 provides an overview of Harbor, and an explanation of the vulnerability.

#CVE_2024_22278 #vulnerability #CVE #Harbor

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.493Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
Google does not know how to count past five as they state 5 security fixes but list 6 externally reported vulnerabilities:

  1. CVE-2024-7532 (critical) Out of bounds memory access in ANGLE
  2. CVE-2024-7533 (high) Use after free in Sharing.
  3. CVE-2024-7550 (high) Type Confusion in V8.
  4. CVE-2024-7534 (high) Heap buffer overflow in Layout
  5. CVE-2024-7535 (high): Inappropriate implementation in V8
  6. CVE-2024-7536 (high) Use after free in WebAudio.

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_7532 #Google #Chrome #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-06T20:15:19.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-38166
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-07T00:30:52

2 posts

An unauthenticated attacker can exploit improper neutralization of input during web page generation in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to spoof over a network by tricking a user to click on a link.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T00:29:47.861Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-38206 (8.5 high) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    An authenticated attacker can bypass Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) protection in Microsoft Copilot Studio to leak sensitive information over a network.
  • CVE-2024-38166 (8.2 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
    An unauthenticated attacker can exploit improper neutralization of input during web page generation in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to spoof over a network by tricking a user to click on a link.

The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Both vulnerabilities are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#CVE_2024_38206 #CVE_2024_38166 #Microsoft #MSRC #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday #Copilot #dynamics365

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T00:29:47.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-38206 (8.5 high) Microsoft Copilot Studio Information Disclosure Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-38166 (8.2 high) Microsoft Dynamics 365 Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
    An unauthenticated attacker can exploit improper neutralization of input during web page generation in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to spoof over a network by tricking a user to click on a link.

The vulnerability documented by this CVE requires no customer action to resolve

Both vulnerabilities are not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

CVE-2024-6886
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-06T16:30:24.547000

4 posts

Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Gitea Gitea Open Source Git Server allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Gitea Open Source Git Server: 1.22.0.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T22:22:21.849Z ##

Gitea security advisory: Gitea Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability
Never heard of Gitea until today but it's apparently an "open source Git repository management system" and someone on Reddit said "Gitea is effectively a github clone that runs on-premises. It's a single binary, written in Go"; Shodan search for the word shows in the ballpark of 890 results.

CVE-2024-6886 (CVSSv4: perfect 10.0 maximum severity ð¥³ cc: @cR0w) Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Gitea Gitea Open Source Git Server allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Gitea Open Source Git Server: 1.22.0.

Interestingly, their security advisory uses CVSSv3.1 (9.8 critical) while the score provided to MITRE/NVD is 4.0 ð¤No mention of exploitation, but it looks like a trivial bug. h/t: @patchnow24x7

#CVE_2024_6886 #Gitea #vulnerability #CVE

mailcow: dockerized is an open source groupware/email suite based on docker. A vulnerability has been discovered in the two-factor authentication (2FA) mechanism. This flaw allows an authenticated attacker to bypass the 2FA protection, enabling unauthorized access to other accounts that are otherwise secured with 2FA. To exploit this vulnerability, the attacker must first have access to an account

CVE-2024-38856
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-06T15:31:53

11 posts

Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in Apache OFBiz. This issue affects Apache OFBiz: through 18.12.14. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.15, which fixes the issue. Unauthenticated endpoints could allow execution of screen rendering code of screens if some preconditions are met (such as when the screen definitions don't explicitly check user's permissions because they rely on

Nuclei template

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T16:18:01.677Z ##

@da_667 My takeaway is that CVE-2024-38856 is a patch-bypass of CVE-2024-36104, which is a path traversal. I had an issue with SonicWall calling it a zero-day, which implied that it was known to threat actors. No evidence given.

PoC diffing with https://github.com/Mr-xn/CVE-2024-32113

##
zeljkazorz at 2024-08-05T13:50:12.119Z ##

CVE-2024-38856, an incorrect authorization vulnerability affecting all but the latest version of Apache OFBiz, may be exploited by remote, unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable systems.

https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/05/cve-2024-38856/

#Cybersecurity #OFBiz #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T13:22:29.871Z ##

SonicWall: SonicWall Discovers Second Critical Apache OFBiz Zero-Day Vulnerability
Does SonicWall understand what a zero-day is?? They provide no evidence that anyone else knew of this vulnerability prior to the vendor patching. "SonicWall is unaware of any active exploitation."
SonicWall provides a root cause analysis of CVE-2024-38856 (submitter assigned 9.8 critical, disclosed 05 August 2024) Incorrect Authorization vulnerability in Apache OFBiz, which they consider a pre-auth remote code execution. They were able to bypass a patch for CVE-2024-36104 (path traversal). No Proof of Concept exploit provided.

#CVE_2024_38856 #ApacheOFbiz #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-42010
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-06T15:31:53

4 posts

mod_css_styles in Roundcube through 1.5.7 and 1.6.x through 1.6.7 allows a insufficiently filters Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequences in rendered e-mail messages, allowing a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T16:38:30.158Z ##

SonarSource: Government Emails at Risk: Critical Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail
SonarSource discloses cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Roundcube:

  • CVE-2024-42008 (high?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42009 (critical?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42010 unknown

Why you should care about CVE-2024-42008, CVE-2024-42009, CVE-2024-42010:
CISA added a whopping SEVEN RoundCube CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, four of them are XSS. As SonarSource noted, "In October 2023, ESET Research reported that a similar vulnerability was actively used by the APT group Winter Vivern to attack European government entities."

#CVE_2024_42008 #CVE_2024_42009 #CVE_2024_42010 #RoundCube #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-43114
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-06T15:30:53

4 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.07.1 possible privilege escalation due to incorrect directory permissions

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T17:09:56.987Z ##

JetBrains security advisory: TeamCity 2024.07.1 Bug Fix Is Out
This is one of the few JetBrains blog posts that acknowledges security fixes. The last one is from 27 June 2024. "This bug fix update resolves over 30 issues..." and TeamCity 2024.07.1 Release Notesï»¿ states "6 security problems have been fixed." Their Security Bulletin is worthless because it hasn't been updated yet. A quick check of TeamCity in CVE.mitre.org shows 1 new CVE ID for 06 August 2024: CVE-2024-43114 (7.8 high) In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.07.1 possible privilege escalation due to incorrect directory permissions. No mention of exploitation in the JetBrains blog post.

#CVE_2024_43114 #JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2018-0824
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.00%

updated 2024-08-06T03:31:52

8 posts

A remote code execution vulnerability exists in "Microsoft COM for Windows" when it fails to properly handle serialized objects, aka "Microsoft COM for Windows Remote Code Execution Vulnerability." This affects Windows 7, Windows Server 2012 R2, Windows RT 8.1, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2012, Windows 8.1, Windows Server 2016, Windows Server 2008 R2, Windows 10, Windows 10 Servers.

1 repos

https://github.com/codewhitesec/UnmarshalPwn

breachhq at 2024-08-12T10:10:22.710Z ##

ð¨#DataBreachð¨
In July 2023, a Taiwan-based government-affiliated research institute specializing in advanced computing was compromised by the China-linked hacking group APT41. The breach involved the deployment of various sophisticated malware tools, including the ShadowPad remote access trojan (RAT), the Cobalt Strike post-compromise tool, and a custom loader exploiting a 2018 Windows remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2018-0824...
https://breach-hq.com/breaches/taiwan-research-institute/2022-jul

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-08-06T20:06:46.000Z ##

Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-08-05
Vulnerability: Microsoft COM for Windows Deserialization of Untrusted Data Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2018-0824

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T15:24:37.148Z ##

@buherator Previously, CISA must not have had any evidence of exploitation before now. Cisco's reporting on Thursday demonstrated that APT41 uses the "UnmarshalPwn" malware to exploit CVE-2018-0824 for local privilege escalation.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T15:09:35.408Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2018-0824 (7.5 high, disclosed 08 May 2018 by Microsoft) Microsoft COM for Windows Remote Code Execution Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog! See parent toot above for evidence of exploitation.

#CVE_2018_0824 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-01T13:23:14.422Z ##

Cisco Talos: APT41 likely compromised Taiwanese government-affiliated research institute with ShadowPad and Cobalt Strike
Cisco attributes a cyberespionage campaign targeting a Taiwanese government-affiliated research institute since at least July 2023, to the Chinese state-sponsored APT41 (aka Winnti, Wicked Panda, Brass Typhoon). APT41 is publicly attributed to several Chinese nationals working at Chengdu 404 Technology by the U.S. government. The ShadowPad malware used in the current campaign exploited an outdated vulnerable version of Microsoft Office IME binary as a loader to load the customized second-stage loader for launching the payload. Cisco also discovered that APT41 created a tailored loader to inject a proof-of-concept for CVE-2018-0824 (7.5 high, disclosed 08 May 2018 by Microsoft, Microsoft COM for Windows Remote Code Execution Vulnerability) directly into memory, utilizing a remote code execution vulnerability to achieve local privilege escalation. Short summary of the victim, attribution, TTP changes and malware analysis. IOC provided.

#threatintel #china #apt41 #cyberespionage #IOC #WickedPanda #BrassTyphoon #Winnti #shadowpad #CVE_2018_0824 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-05T15:24:37.000Z ##

@buherator Previously, CISA must not have had any evidence of exploitation before now. Cisco's reporting on Thursday demonstrated that APT41 uses the "UnmarshalPwn" malware to exploit CVE-2018-0824 for local privilege escalation.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-05T15:09:35.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds CVE-2018-0824 (7.5 high, disclosed 08 May 2018 by Microsoft) Microsoft COM for Windows Remote Code Execution Vulnerability to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog! See parent toot above for evidence of exploitation.

#CVE_2018_0824 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE #Microsoft #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-01T13:23:14.000Z ##

Cisco Talos: APT41 likely compromised Taiwanese government-affiliated research institute with ShadowPad and Cobalt Strike
Cisco attributes a cyberespionage campaign targeting a Taiwanese government-affiliated research institute since at least July 2023, to the Chinese state-sponsored APT41 (aka Winnti, Wicked Panda, Brass Typhoon). APT41 is publicly attributed to several Chinese nationals working at Chengdu 404 Technology by the U.S. government. The ShadowPad malware used in the current campaign exploited an outdated vulnerable version of Microsoft Office IME binary as a loader to load the customized second-stage loader for launching the payload. Cisco also discovered that APT41 created a tailored loader to inject a proof-of-concept for CVE-2018-0824 (7.5 high, disclosed 08 May 2018 by Microsoft, Microsoft COM for Windows Remote Code Execution Vulnerability) directly into memory, utilizing a remote code execution vulnerability to achieve local privilege escalation. Short summary of the victim, attribution, TTP changes and malware analysis. IOC provided.

#threatintel #china #apt41 #cyberespionage #IOC #WickedPanda #BrassTyphoon #Winnti #shadowpad #CVE_2018_0824 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-42009(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-05T21:31:25

6 posts

A Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability in Roundcube through 1.5.7 and 1.6.x through 1.6.7 allows a remote attacker to steal and send emails of a victim via a crafted e-mail message that abuses a Desanitization issue in message_body() in program/actions/mail/show.php.

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-08-07T09:40:03.000Z ##

Roundcube flaws allow easy email account compromise (CVE-2024-42009, CVE-2024-42008) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/08/07/cve-2024-42009-cve-2024-42008/ #securityupdate #emailsecurity #vulnerability #opensource #Don'tmiss #Roundcube #Hotstuff #Sonar #News #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T16:38:30.158Z ##

SonarSource: Government Emails at Risk: Critical Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability in Roundcube Webmail
SonarSource discloses cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Roundcube:

  • CVE-2024-42008 (high?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42009 (critical?) XSS
  • CVE-2024-42010 unknown

Why you should care about CVE-2024-42008, CVE-2024-42009, CVE-2024-42010:
CISA added a whopping SEVEN RoundCube CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog, four of them are XSS. As SonarSource noted, "In October 2023, ESET Research reported that a similar vulnerability was actively used by the APT group Winter Vivern to attack European government entities."

#CVE_2024_42008 #CVE_2024_42009 #CVE_2024_42010 #RoundCube #vulnerability #CVE

##

CVE-2024-4607
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-05T16:35:14.117000

2 posts

Use After Free vulnerability in Arm Ltd Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Valhall GPU Kernel Driver, Arm Ltd Arm 5th Gen GPU Architecture Kernel Driver allows a local non-privileged user to make improper GPU memory processing operations to gain access to already freed memory.This issue affects Bifrost GPU Kernel Driver: from r41p0 through r49p0; Valhall GPU Kernel Driver: from r41p0 through r49p0

screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T11:36:07.679Z ##

ARM security advisory: Mali GPU Driver Vulnerabilities
Normally I don't care about Arm vulnerabilities but since there's been a string of exploited zero-days in the past, I figured I'd keep tabs on it. 2 vulnerabilities: CVE-2024-2937 and CVE-2024-4607 both have the same title (Mali GPU Kernel Driver allows improper GPU memory processing operations), affected products and description. No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_2937 #CVE_2024_4607 #Arm #vulnerability #CVE

CVE-2024-6922(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-05T05:05:52

1 posts

Automation Anywhere Automation 360 v21-v32 is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in a web API component. An attacker with unauthenticated access to the Automation 360 Control Room HTTPS service (port 443) or HTTP service (port 80) can trigger arbitrary web requests from the server.

Nuclei template

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-30T20:52:58.512Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
3 security fixes, all externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-6990 (CRITICAL) Uninitialized Use in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-7255 (high) Out of bounds read in WebTransport.
  • CVE-2024-7256 (high) Insufficient data validation in Dawn

No mention of exploitation but this is the first critical I've seen in months/year.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #patchtuesday #CVE

CVE-2024-39877
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-02T15:52:55

2 posts

Apache Airflow 2.4.0, and versions before 2.9.3, has a vulnerability that allows authenticated DAG authors to craft a doc_md parameter in a way that could execute arbitrary code in the scheduler context, which should be forbidden according to the Airflow Security model. Users should upgrade to version 2.9.3 or later which has removed the vulnerability.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-01T13:10:19.990Z ##

SecureLayer7: CVE-2024-39877: Apache Airflow Arbitrary Code Execution
SecureLayer7 provides patch-diffing and vulnerability analysis of CVE-2024-39877 (8.8 high, disclosed 16 July 2024 by Apache) Apache Airflow Arbitrary Code Execution. They then describe a step-by-step breakdown of an attack scenario which is basically a weaponized proof of concept.

#CVE_2024_39877 #vulnerability #CVE #ApacheAirflow #proofofconcept

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-01T13:10:19.000Z ##

CVE-2024-7029
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-02T15:31:27

2 posts

Commands can be injected over the network and executed without authentication.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-02T11:54:19.745Z ##

Security Week: CISA Warns of Avtech Camera Vulnerability Exploited in Wild
In yesterday's CISA ICS Advisory AVTECH IP Camera, CISA includes the following verbiage:

ATTENTION: Exploitable remotely/low attack complexity/public exploits are available/known public exploitation

Additionally, "An anonymous third-party organization confirmed Akamai's report and identified specific affected products and firmware versions." AVTECH SECURITY Corporation has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

So there you have it CVE-2024-7029 (8.8 high) command injection vulnerability is likely an unpatched and exploited zero-day.

#CVE_2024_7029 #activeexploitation #zeroday #vulnerability #cve #avtech #cisa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-02T11:54:19.000Z ##

Security Week: CISA Warns of Avtech Camera Vulnerability Exploited in Wild
In yesterday's CISA ICS Advisory AVTECH IP Camera, CISA includes the following verbiage:

ATTENTION: Exploitable remotely/low attack complexity/public exploits are available/known public exploitation

Additionally, "An anonymous third-party organization confirmed Akamai's report and identified specific affected products and firmware versions." AVTECH SECURITY Corporation has not responded to requests to work with CISA to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

So there you have it CVE-2024-7029 (8.8 high) command injection vulnerability is likely an unpatched and exploited zero-day.

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-02T15:16:26

4 posts

Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection') vulnerability in Apache InLong. This issue affects Apache InLong: from 1.10.0 through 1.12.0, which could lead to Remote Code Execution. Users are advised to upgrade to Apache InLong's 1.13.0 or cherry-pick [1] to solve it. [1]Â  https://github.com/apache/inlong/pull/10251

Immediate Action Required: Critical Apache InLong Vulnerability Exploitable https://thecyberexpress.com/cve-2024-36268-vulnerability-exploitable/ #ApacheInLongproject #TheCyberExpressNews #CybersecurityNews #VulnerabilityNews #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE202436268 #TubeMQ

##

CVE-2024-39396
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-02T09:31:39

2 posts

InDesign Desktop versions ID18.5.2, ID19.3 and earlier are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T22:08:31.421Z ##

Adobe quietly updated a 09 July 2024 security advisory for Adobe InDesign (APSB24-48), adding two vulnerabilities on 01 August 2024:

  • CVE-2024-39392 (7.8 high) Heap-based Buffer Overflow > Arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-39396 (5.5 medium) Out-of-bounds Read > Memory leak (information disclosure)

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_39392 #CVE_2024_39396 #Adobe #InDesign #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-05T22:08:31.000Z ##

Adobe quietly updated a 09 July 2024 security advisory for Adobe InDesign (APSB24-48), adding two vulnerabilities on 01 August 2024:

  • CVE-2024-39392 (7.8 high) Heap-based Buffer Overflow > Arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-39396 (5.5 medium) Out-of-bounds Read > Memory leak (information disclosure)

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_39392 #CVE_2024_39396 #Adobe #InDesign #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2024-39392
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-02T09:31:39

2 posts

InDesign Desktop versions ID18.5.2, ID19.3 and earlier are affected by a Heap-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-05T22:08:31.421Z ##

Adobe quietly updated a 09 July 2024 security advisory for Adobe InDesign (APSB24-48), adding two vulnerabilities on 01 August 2024:

  • CVE-2024-39392 (7.8 high) Heap-based Buffer Overflow > Arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-39396 (5.5 medium) Out-of-bounds Read > Memory leak (information disclosure)

No mention of exploitation.

#CVE_2024_39392 #CVE_2024_39396 #Adobe #InDesign #vulnerability #CVE #PatchTuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-05T22:08:31.000Z ##

Adobe quietly updated a 09 July 2024 security advisory for Adobe InDesign (APSB24-48), adding two vulnerabilities on 01 August 2024:

  • CVE-2024-39392 (7.8 high) Heap-based Buffer Overflow > Arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-39396 (5.5 medium) Out-of-bounds Read > Memory leak (information disclosure)

No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-32113
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.01%

updated 2024-08-01T21:32:46

9 posts

Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.13. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.13, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

3 repos

https://github.com/YongYe-Security/CVE-2024-32113

https://github.com/RacerZ-fighting/CVE-2024-32113-POC

https://github.com/Mr-xn/CVE-2024-32113

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T14:15:48.703Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds two CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-36971 (7.8 high) Android Kernel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

EDIT: In case anyone is wondering why it says "Access Denied", I'm too quick for CISA, and they haven't officially published the blog post. It will be available sometime in the next few hours.

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36971 #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE #Apache #OFbiz #Android

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T14:15:48.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA adds two CVEs to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-36971 (7.8 high) Android Kernel Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

EDIT: In case anyone is wondering why it says "Access Denied", I'm too quick for CISA, and they haven't officially published the blog post. It will be available sometime in the next few hours.

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36971 #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #CISA #vulnerability #CVE #Apache #OFbiz #Android

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-08-07T15:00:47.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-32113
Vendor: Apache
Product: OFBiz
Date Added: 2024-08-07
Vulnerability: Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. Please check with specific vendors for information on patching status. For more information, please see: https://lists.apache.org/thread/w6s60okgkxp2th1sr8vx0ndmgk68fqrd
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-32113

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-06T16:18:01.677Z ##

@da_667 My takeaway is that CVE-2024-38856 is a patch-bypass of CVE-2024-36104, which is a path traversal. I had an issue with SonicWall calling it a zero-day, which implied that it was known to threat actors. No evidence given.

PoC diffing with https://github.com/Mr-xn/CVE-2024-32113

##

CVE-2024-7255(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T18:32:56

2 posts

Out of bounds read in WebTransport in Google Chrome prior to 127.0.6533.88 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-07-30T20:52:58.512Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
3 security fixes, all externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-6990 (CRITICAL) Uninitialized Use in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-7255 (high) Out of bounds read in WebTransport.
  • CVE-2024-7256 (high) Insufficient data validation in Dawn

No mention of exploitation but this is the first critical I've seen in months/year.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #patchtuesday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-07-30T20:52:58.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: Stable Channel Update for Desktop
3 security fixes, all externally reported:

  • CVE-2024-6990 (CRITICAL) Uninitialized Use in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-7255 (high) Out of bounds read in WebTransport.
  • CVE-2024-7256 (high) Insufficient data validation in Dawn

No mention of exploitation but this is the first critical I've seen in months/year.

##

CVE-2024-41611
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:24

2 posts

In D-Link DIR-860L REVA FIRMWARE PATCH 1.10..B04, the Telnet service contains hardcoded credentials, enabling attackers to log in remotely to the Telnet service and perform arbitrary commands.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T17:04:48.306Z ##

Sometimes it's worth checking out CISA's Vulnerability Summary, just to see what the cyber publications missed. For example in Monday's Vulnerability Summary for the Week of July 29, 2024, you'll see that D-Link, a Taiwanese networking/telecoms hardware company, has two vulnerabilities CVE-2024-41610 and CVE-2024-41611 with a CVSSv3.1 score of 9.8 critical and reads "contains hardcoded credentials in the Telnet service, enabling attackers to log in remotely to the Telnet service and perform arbitrary commands."

D-Link doesn't even list CVE IDs on their dedicated security advisories page.

And this is not the first time D-Link has been caught with hardcoded credentials:

  • 09 September 2017 by @campuscodi: Researcher Publishes Details on Unpatched D-Link Router Flaws
  • 02 July 2019 by @serghei: D-Link Settles FTC Lawsuit, Promises to Enhance Device Security
  • 16 July 2021: D-Link issues hotfix for hard-coded password router vulnerabilities
  • 06 April 2024: Over 92,000 exposed D-Link NAS devices have a backdoor account
    • 08 April 2024: Critical RCE bug in 92,000 D-Link NAS devices now exploited in attacks

At this rate, I wouldn't trust that a D-Link product doesn't have hardcoded credentials baked in. smh.

#Dlink #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41610 #CVE_2024_41611

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-07T17:04:48.000Z ##

Sometimes it's worth checking out CISA's Vulnerability Summary, just to see what the cyber publications missed. For example in Monday's Vulnerability Summary for the Week of July 29, 2024, you'll see that D-Link, a Taiwanese networking/telecoms hardware company, has two vulnerabilities CVE-2024-41610 and CVE-2024-41611 with a CVSSv3.1 score of 9.8 critical and reads "contains hardcoded credentials in the Telnet service, enabling attackers to log in remotely to the Telnet service and perform arbitrary commands."

D-Link doesn't even list CVE IDs on their dedicated security advisories page.

And this is not the first time D-Link has been caught with hardcoded credentials:

  • 09 September 2017 by @campuscodi: Researcher Publishes Details on Unpatched D-Link Router Flaws
  • 02 July 2019 by @serghei: D-Link Settles FTC Lawsuit, Promises to Enhance Device Security
  • 16 July 2021: D-Link issues hotfix for hard-coded password router vulnerabilities
  • 06 April 2024: Over 92,000 exposed D-Link NAS devices have a backdoor account
    • 08 April 2024: Critical RCE bug in 92,000 D-Link NAS devices now exploited in attacks

At this rate, I wouldn't trust that a D-Link product doesn't have hardcoded credentials baked in. smh.

(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-01T15:33:23

2 posts

screaminggoat at 2024-08-07T17:04:48.306Z ##

Sometimes it's worth checking out CISA's Vulnerability Summary, just to see what the cyber publications missed. Sometimes it's worth checking out CISA's Vulnerability Summary, just to see what the cyber publications missed. For example in Monday's Vulnerability Summary for the Week of July 29, 2024, you'll see that D-Link, a Taiwanese networking/telecoms hardware company, has two vulnerabilities CVE-2024-41610 and CVE-2024-41611 with a CVSSv3.1 score of 9.8 critical and reads "contains hardcoded credentials in the Telnet service, enabling attackers to log in remotely to the Telnet service and perform arbitrary commands."

D-Link doesn't even list CVE IDs on their dedicated security advisories page.

  • 09 September 2017 by @campuscodi: Researcher Publishes Details on Unpatched D-Link Router Flaws
  • 02 July 2019 by @serghei: D-Link Settles FTC Lawsuit, Promises to Enhance Device Security
  • 16 July 2021: D-Link issues hotfix for hard-coded password router vulnerabilities

At this rate, I wouldn't trust that a D-Link product doesn't have hardcoded credentials baked in. smh.

##

CVE-2022-24975
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.14%

updated 2024-08-01T09:30:49

1 posts

The --mirror documentation for Git through 2.35.1 does not mention the availability of deleted content, aka the "GitBleed" issue. This could present a security risk if information-disclosure auditing processes rely on a clone operation without the --mirror option.

eslerm@cyberplace.social at 2024-08-01T03:00:21.000Z ##

git's CVE-2022-24975 is a bogus CVE

Junio explained this: https://lore.kernel.org/git/xmqq4k14qe9g.fsf@gitster.g/

Nighthawk Cybersecurity knew this before requesting a bogus assignment https://wwws.nightwatchcybersecurity.com/2022/02/11/gitbleed/

And the recent Aqua and Truffle Security posts are also FUD
https://www.aquasec.com/blog/undetected-hard-code-secrets-expose-corporations/
https://trufflesecurity.com/blog/anyone-can-access-deleted-and-private-repo-data-github

Yes, git allows foot guns.

edit: Truffle Security found an issue that goes beyond CVE-2022-24975 and affects at least GitHub. Thanks @insecurenature

##

CVE-2024-38182
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-08-01T00:33:29

2 posts

Weak authentication in Microsoft Dynamics 365 allows an unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

screaminggoat at 2024-08-01T02:31:41.710Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
CVE-2024-38182 (9.0 critical) Weak authentication in Microsoft Dynamics 365 allows an unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

Why are there no links to an update or instructions with steps that must be taken to protect from this vulnerability
This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

MSRC also revised the CVSSv3.1 score for CVE-2024-37973 (disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft) Secure Boot Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, going from 7.8 high to 8.8 high. (AV:L became AV:A for adjacent) Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

#Microsoft #PatchTuesday #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_38182 #CVE_2024_37973

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-01T02:31:41.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) security advisory: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability
CVE-2024-38182 (9.0 critical) Weak authentication in Microsoft Dynamics 365 allows an unauthenticated attacker to elevate privileges over a network.

Why are there no links to an update or instructions with steps that must be taken to protect from this vulnerability
This vulnerability has already been fully mitigated by Microsoft. There is no action for users of this service to take. This purpose of this CVE is to provide further transparency.

Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

MSRC also revised the CVSSv3.1 score for CVE-2024-37973 (disclosed 09 July 2024 by Microsoft) Secure Boot Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability, going from 7.8 high to 8.8 high. (AV:L became AV:A for adjacent) Not exploited, not publicly disclosed, exploitation less likely.

##

CVE-2024-6387
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 71.47%

updated 2024-07-30T03:31:55

4 posts

A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

93 repos

CVE-2024-23296
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.16%

updated 2024-07-30T03:30:51

5 posts

A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 17.4 and iPadOS 17.4. An attacker with arbitrary kernel read and write capability may be able to bypass kernel memory protections. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

screaminggoat at 2024-07-30T17:20:20.902Z ##

@applsec just as a note, CVE-2024-23296 is a known exploited vulnerability that was initially disclosed on 07 March 2024 and added to CISA's KEV Catalog on the same day.

Impact: An attacker with arbitrary kernel read and write capability may be able to bypass kernel memory protections. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-07-29T22:53:03.048Z ##

Apple security advisories, no new zero-days:

  • About the security content of Safari 17.6 (9 new CVEs)
  • About the security content of iOS 17.6 and iPadOS 17.6 (35 new)
  • About the security content of iOS 16.7.9 and iPadOS 16.7.9 (26 new)
  • About the security content of macOS Sonoma 14.6 (69, nice)
  • About the security content of macOS Ventura 13.6.8 (44 new + (at least) 1 old = 45)
    • Note: CVE-2024-23296 (7.8 high, disclosed 07 March 2024, in CISA KEV Catalog) was a previously exploited zero-day in RTKit. Patch was backported to macOS Ventura 13.6.8
  • About the security content of macOS Monterey 12.7.6 (41)
  • About the security content of watchOS 10.6 (29)
  • About the security content of tvOS 17.6 (19)
  • About the security content of visionOS 1.3 (19)

No mention of exploitation besides the one I highlighted. h/t: @applsec

Older advisories were also updated:

  • About the security content of macOS Sonoma 14.4 (original publish date: 07 March 2024) 8 new
  • About the security content of macOS Sonoma 14.5 (original publish date: 13 May 2024) 4 new, 1 updated

  • About the security content of tvOS 17.5 (original publish date: 13 May 2024) 3 new

CVE-2024-4032(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-07-28T15:32:29

1 posts

The âipaddressâ module contained incorrect information about whether certain IPv4 and IPv6 addresses were designated as âglobally reachableâ or âprivateâ. This affected the is_private and is_global properties of the ipaddress.IPv4Address, ipaddress.IPv4Network, ipaddress.IPv6Address, and ipaddress.IPv6Network classes, where values wouldnât be returned in accordance with the latest information from

1 repos

#search_error

cliffb_infosec@mastodon.social at 2024-08-01T17:33:11.000Z ##

Reason Python is a dumpster fire #394820: Naive and wrong networking tests for decades.

I found this problem like 5 years ago while working with a CSPM. They told me their private/global tests were just these Python tests. And when I investigated, I found that Python had a very naive concept (only private vs global, in-set vs out-of-set), and that it was factually wrong (did not match IANA).

https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2024-4032

updated 2024-07-26T18:30:45

screaminggoat at 2024-07-30T15:05:51.086Z ##

  • CVE-2024-38871 - Authenticated SQL injection vulnerability in Exchange Reporter Plus
    CVE-2024-38871 (8.3 high, disclosed 15 July 2024)
  • CVE-2024-38872 - Authenticated SQL injection vulnerability in Exchange Reporter Plus
    CVE-2024-38872 (8.3 high, disclosed 15 July 2024)

No mention of exploitation. Here's why you should care about CVE-2024-38871 and CVE-2024-38872:
Zoho ManageEngine is very popular among threat actors (especially ransomware groups!) as EIGHT ManageEngine-specific vulnerabilities are on CISA's KEV Catalog.

# Summary Log4j versions prior to 2.16.0 are subject to a remote code execution vulnerability via the ldap JNDI parser. For enterpri$e folk, we've made it pretty simple to get exploitation information for a given CVE (tags map to CVEs but the GNQL query to do the same wasn't as easy and we return lots more info now).

Tap this and start free trial to see the new interface and the API (also has integrations into Splunk, Cortex, Nucleus,.etc).

https://viz.greynoise.io/cves/CVE-2021-44228?days=30

##
kurtseifried at 2024-08-05T02:58:07.137Z ##

@bcdavid @brianleroux #log4j didn't results in massive flight cancellations for example.

The primary cost of log4j was remediation, not BSOD'ed computers taking out other services.

While there was exploitation of log4j (even prior to it being public, e.g. https://blog.cloudflare.com/exploitation-of-cve-2021-44228-before-public-disclosure-and-evolution-of-waf-evasion-patterns) but even that was barely a blip.

##
hrbrmstr@mastodon.social at 2024-08-12T14:43:37.000Z ##

For enterpri$e folk, we've made it pretty simple to get exploitation information for a given CVE (tags map to CVEs but the GNQL query to do the same wasn't as easy and we return lots more info now).

Tap this and start free trial to see the new interface and the API (also has integrations into Splunk, Cortex, Nucleus,.etc).

https://viz.greynoise.io/cves/CVE-2021-44228?days=30

##
kurtseifried@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-05T02:58:07.000Z ##

@bcdavid @brianleroux #log4j didn't results in massive flight cancellations for example.

The primary cost of log4j was remediation, not BSOD'ed computers taking out other services.

While there was exploitation of log4j (even prior to it being public, e.g. https://blog.cloudflare.com/exploitation-of-cve-2021-44228-before-public-disclosure-and-evolution-of-waf-evasion-patterns) but even that was barely a blip.

##

CVE-2017-11774
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 80.13%

updated 2024-07-25T15:31:37

4 posts

Microsoft Outlook 2010 SP2, Outlook 2013 SP1 and RT SP1, and Outlook 2016 allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands, due to how Microsoft Office handles objects in memory, aka "Microsoft Outlook Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability."

1 repos

https://github.com/devcoinfet/SniperRoost

screaminggoat at 2024-07-30T14:51:06.854Z ##

TrustedSec: Specula
TrustedSec published a post-exploitation framework called Specula, which uses Microsoft Outlook as a Command and Control agent. One of the vulnerabilities leveraged by Specula is CVE-2017-11774 (7.8 high, disclosed 10 October 2017 by Microsoft, added to CISA KEV 03 November 2021) Microsoft Outlook Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability. "Specula runs purely in Outlook's context, and it works by setting a custom Outlook home page via registry keys that call out to an interactive Python web server."
See related Bleeping Computer reporting: New Specula tool uses Outlook for remote code execution in Windows

#outlook #specula #CVE_2017_11774

##
jbhall56 at 2024-07-30T11:11:56.266Z ##

This C2 framework works by creating a custom Outlook Home Page using WebView by exploiting CVE-2017-11774, an Outlook security feature bypass vulnerability patched in October 2017. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-specula-tool-uses-outlook-for-remote-code-execution-in-windows/

##

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-23T09:30:39

1 posts

RADIUS Protocol under RFC 2865 is susceptible to forgery attacks by a local attacker who can modify any valid Response (Access-Accept, Access-Reject, or Access-Challenge) to any other response using a chosen-prefix collision attack against MD5 Response Authenticator signature.

An reflected XSS vulnerability exists in the handling of invalid paths in the Flask server in Ankitects Anki 24.04. A specially crafted flashcard can lead to JavaScript code execution and result in an arbitrary file read. An attacker can share a malicious flashcard to trigger this vulnerability.

CVE-2024-34102
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.32%

updated 2024-07-17T19:15:32

2 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.7, 2.4.6-p5, 2.4.5-p7, 2.4.4-p8 and earlier are affected by an Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference ('XXE') vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted XML document that references external entities. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.
